meanings.definition: Make (something needed or wanted) available to someone; provide.
meanings.sent1: I will supply the tools for the project.
meanings.sent2: The store will supply fresh fruits and vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The magician asked the rabbit to supply a deck of cards.
meanings.sent4: Her smile supplied warmth to the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun supplies light to the earth every day.

meanings.definition: A stock or amount of something available for use.
meanings.sent1: The army has a large supply of ammunition.
meanings.sent2: The school cafeteria has a supply of snacks for the students.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's supply of acorns was hidden in the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a never-ending supply of joy.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest held a supply of gold coins.

meanings.sent1: The supply of blankets to the homeless was appreciated.
meanings.sent2: The supply of water to the village was crucial.
meanings.sent3: The supply of jokes at the party kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent4: Her supply of kindness never ran out.
meanings.sent5: The supply of books in the library was vast.
